page.title: 05A HISTORY OF ROCKPORT
page.content: In 1817 Rockport was built as a private dwelling by John Turnly (1764 - 1841).When he died his son occupied the house until the late 1850s when a Captain May took over.The Mays remained as occupants until 1906 when a Geoffrey Bing bought the house and set up Rockport Preparatory School, of which he was the first headmaster.In 1944 Mr Eric Tucker took over the school and remained as head until 1974 when he was succeeded by Mr John Agg Large who , at the time of writing ,has just announced his intention to leave in July 1986. Rockport School began with only three pupils and now has about two hundred so many alterations have had to be made, over the years, to original buildings. (CONTINUED)
